channel.title: How to play [for free] (AUTO UPDATING NOW)
channel.description:
Although, I believe in buying games, I always believe in 'Trials' (or in this case, trials cannot be done, otherwise I would have implemented it). I took some time and broke through the launchers username checking (about 12 lines of code), and the validation process (actually, just removed the method from being called).
The downloads are moved to my shitty blog. http://soharuda.webuda.com/cracked-minecraft/
Just download this, and run it like any other JAR application. It will do the dirty work upon first login. You can play via Multiplayer as long as the server has 'Online-Mode' set to false. This setting does not do like it says, and have the server online or not, but rather if the server should check usernames. Single player works fine, as if you were payed.
UPDATE: I have added in an auto update feature. Please note you may not get the update until hours later, but it will come at some point during the day. The version is being fetched from a website, not the minecraft servers. I wrote a program to update the site's version. NOTE: If you are moving from my previous launcher, backup your minecraft.jar if you had any mods installed. This now uses a dynamic version instead of a set '12' like I was an idiot and did. It should update fine now and work like a charm.

item.title: How to play [for free] (AUTO UPDATING NOW)
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

So I have edited my old launcher to run from a separate location (uses same saves/texture packs folders and such as default) just a few of the essential things will run from a separate location. Would this be worth releasing? This means that I could fully finish a custom updater script via PHP and such, meaning your moparcraft client would not need to be downgraded after each upgrade, but instead just update to a version moparcraft (or i) could host.

Pros:
[ul][li]Some client-sided mods could go into the “official” moparcraft update if they deem worthy.[/li]
[li]No need to downgrade all the time[/li]
[li]Can load your normal worlds and keep playing if necessary.[/li]
[li]Just as easy to use as official minecraft.[/li]
[li]Easier than ever to play.[/li][/ul]

Cons:
[ul][li]If a mod got pissed off he could release an update with a backdoor to a virus and nobody would know.[/li]
[li]No idea if your computer could handle the mods that go official.[/li]
[li]Problems for if mod was built for multicore and your on singlecore CPU[/li]
[li]Have to install your mods again (sorry).[/li][/ul]

Read full topic
item.source: How to play [for free] (AUTO UPDATING NOW)

item.title: How to play [for free] (AUTO UPDATING NOW)
item.dc:creator: @Phaze_One Fuscate
item.description:
@Phaze_One wrote:

Mr...x..:

I have downloaded this on two of my computer, I spent days working on a map in single player mode, and I thought, that when I logged on the same account on my different computer it would be there… It is not. Is there anyway that I can put my map from my other computer to this computer?

Open run in your start menu, type in %appdata% then click Run again. Open up the .minecraft folder and then from there open the ‘saves’ folder. Transfer the file via usb, upload site etc to your other computer and presto

Read full topic

item.title: How to play [for free] (AUTO UPDATING NOW)
item.dc:creator: @hat_trix hat trix
item.description:
@hat_trix wrote:

TheCowfishy:

Okay, so I am posting this to save my bum. I have downloaded your cracked version on 5-6 different computers. (desktop, and 3 laptops) One of the laptops was destroyed and was never scanned, thus rendering that one irrelevant (Laptop2). The other one, a family member’s laptop (Laptop1) was scanned a week or two after downloading your cracked copy and came up with 7 viruses. Another family member’s laptop (Laptop3), had the Minecraft copy installed a week ago and it was scanned to reveal 27 viruses total. I immediately deleted Minecraft from Laptop3. I have been unable to remove it from Laptop1, and it seems that it will have to wiped, because it is my grandmothers laptop, and she is really paranoid. On my personal desktop computer, I have not scanned for any viruses yet, but I do have that copy of Minecraft installed. I am not accusing you of anything, I just want to ask you if there is a possibility that any of the viruses could have been obtained through your software. This was written only to prove my innocence in the case, as I am currently bearing the blame for both laptops in question. Thanks in advance for any input.

Quit looking at porn. His launcher doesn’t have viruses.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Journeylas Journeylas
item.description:
@Journeylas wrote:

Hi!
I guess these 1 posts guys are pain in this community but I have a problem, which I cannot fix.
Everytime i try to run different versions of Minecraft bug comes out:

  Minecraft has crashed!      
  ----------------------

Minecraft has stopped running because it encountered a problem.

— BEGIN ERROR REPORT 7cf3a456 --------
Generated 06.05.12 00:18

Minecraft: Minecraft 1.2.5
OS: Windows Vista (x86) version 6.0
Java: 1.6.0_32, Sun Microsystems Inc.
VM: Java HotSpot™ Client VM (mixed mode, sharing), Sun Microsystems Inc.
LWJGL: 2.4.2
OpenGL: null version null, null

java.lang.IllegalStateException: glGetString(GL_VERSION) returned null - possibly caused by missing current context.
at org.lwjgl.opengl.GLContext.getSupportedExtensions(GLContext.java:187)
at org.lwjgl.opengl.ContextCapabilities.initAllStubs(ContextCapabilities.java:4355)
at org.lwjgl.opengl.ContextCapabilities.(ContextCapabilities.java:4661)
at org.lwjgl.opengl.GLContext.useContext(GLContext.java:352)
at org.lwjgl.opengl.Context.makeCurrent(Context.java:183)
at org.lwjgl.opengl.Display.makeCurrent(Display.java:730)
at org.lwjgl.opengl.Display.makeCurrentAndSetSwapInterval(Display.java:896)
at org.lwjgl.opengl.Display.create(Display.java:860)
at org.lwjgl.opengl.Display.create(Display.java:784)
at net.minecraft.client.Minecraft.a(SourceFile:204)
at net.minecraft.client.Minecraft.run(SourceFile:657)
at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source)
— END ERROR REPORT ad7e5a3 ----------

I tried to reinstall java, install 32/64 bits, delete bins folder, edit games files, .bat and shortcuts tricks. None of them works. I run at Windows Vista 64. I also updated and downgraded drives back and forth.
I’d be thankful if my problem could by solved.
Thanks for attention.
Good day.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

Compiled under JDK6. So no

Edit:
Sorry for the delay in the update. Seem’s my laptop was closed while my gf was over. Don’t ask how, as its none of your business, lets juts leave it at that. Got the new version set and its ready to roll.

Edit:
Moved links to my website.

Edit:
If anybody is wondering about the sudden update. I finished re-building my MCLogin script to check for updates. Turns out the last known update in the database was set to 0. Remade script actually found the correct version.
